title: mBLA: Model-Based Learning Analytics
text:
Software

eDidaktikum (2023) 24,731 students, teachers, educational managers and lecturers use eDidaktikum on a daily basis, to collect and share materials and discuss learning and teaching. Source Code: https://github.com/centre-for-educational-technology/edidaktikum
Vara (2023) A H5P-based platform to orchestrate learning activities in classrooms. Source Code: https://github.com/centre-for-educational-technology/vara
laPills (2023) A feedback gathering system for classroom teaching practices. Source Code: https://github.com/centre-for-educational-technology/la_pills
Tinda (2022) A platform to assess digital competencies of teachers in Estonia. Source Code: https://github.com/centre-for-educational-technology/tinda
EzTest (2021) A lightweigh student testing system. Source Code: https://github.com/centre-for-educational-technology/EzTest

title: Model-Based Learning Analytics
text:
We are an interdisciplinary research group based within Center of Education Technology at Tallinn University.
The group is contributing to the field of human-centered LA by taking an integrative and interdisciplinary perspective. We refer to our approach as model-based learning analytics, where the model is referring to pedagogical-psychological concepts that allows us to integrate use of multimodal data from learning situations, evidence-based pedagogical designs and an approach to teacher professional development.



Image:www.freepik.com

title: mBLA: Model-Based Learning Analytics
text:
Research Topics

Learning Science

Pedagogical approaches for developing HOTS – Currently, we are researching to build a pedagogical-psychological model to assist teachers in the development of higher-order thinking skills among students.



Multimodal Learning Analytics

Collaboration quality – We investigate the potential of multimodal data (e.g., audio, video, logs) towards understanding collaboration behavior in classrooms. We build technological support for teachers based on our investigation utilizing multimodal data with machine learning techniques.



Teacher Professional Development

Teacher training – We build effective teacher training programs based on our research with a focus on pedagogical aspects in the context of the technology-enhanced learning environment.

title: mBLA: Model-Based Learning Analytics
text:
Visit Us
The mBLA research group is located in A-317 which is the Center of Education Technology at Tallinn University in Estonia.

Address : Tallinn University, Narva mnt. 29, 10120, Tallinn, Estonia
